title: Research Analyst
description: Company: Rystad Energy AS Job Title: Research Analyst, Southeast Asia Job Location: Jakarta, Indonesia   Rystad Energy is a leading energy research and consulting firm headquartered in Oslo, Norway with over 20 offices across the world. The company was founded in 2004 to provide strategic consulting services and has evolved into one of the leading research organizations with a series of databases and reports covering the global energy industry and other parts of the energy space. Our team of industry experts serve our client base, including the largest oil & gas and energy companies, financial and oilfield service companies.  Description Rystad Energy is looking for an analyst to work in Jakarta as part of our E&P team and contribute to the greater global research teams. Your task will be to survey upstream activity and to provide our clients with leading and relevant intelligence. We are looking for candidates with strong analytical skills regardless of educational and professional background. Candidates will be required to work independently and as part of a team under tight deadlines and be able to juggle multiple priorities.   The E&P team is part of the analyst department in Rystad Energy and is responsible for maintaining and developing our database products within the E&P space. The work consists of collecting and analyzing data and presenting this to clients. This will give you a deep understanding of the global oil industry and you will work in close collaboration with our consultants and programmers, as well as our business developers. No prior oil and gas or upstream related experience is required for the position.   The successful candidate will become part of our global team of analysts working in the E&P department. All necessary training will be provided.   Tasks Obtain and analyze upstream data Model and value oil and gas assets Research and analyze E&P companies’ activities, countries production trends, and fiscal policies, with a focus on Indonesia Identify and determine the impact of external factors such as prices, M&A, geopolitics & policy etc. on activity Write insightful commentaries and participate in webinars on industry trends Contribute into the E&P team’s work to build the core UCube offering Support our external clients, consultants, and business development team   Experience & Skills 0-5 years of relevant work experience University degree in a data driven field such as mathematics, engineering, economics, or finance/business Solid analytical and problem-solving skills Good command of spoken and written English and Bahasa Indonesia and able to demonstrate good writing skills Self-motivated, proactive, and independent as well as a strong team player Only candidates with Indonesia working rights will be considered for this role Bachelor's Degree required, MBA or master's will be a plus Good MS Excel, PowerPoint skills   Application Deadline: 15th of June 2022 The working place will be in our office in Jakarta. Please attach all higher education transcripts to your application Contact Prateek Pandey (prateek.pandey@rystadenergy.com) if you have any questions regarding the position.

title: Global Sustainability, Sustainable Agriculture Sr Analyst
description: Auto req ID: 272868BR  Job Description At its core, PepsiCo is an agricultural company. In April 2021 we set new goals under our Positive Agriculture strategy designed to make a net positive impact across our global value chain including 2030 goals to spread regenerative farming practices across 7 million acres, improve the livelihoods of more than 250,000 people in our agricultural supply chain and sustainably source 100% of our key ingredients.  Under PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture agenda, we're working to source crops and ingredients in a way that accelerates regenerative agriculture and strengthens farming communities. To do this we're supporting the advancement of farming practices to improve soil health, conserve and protect watersheds and biodiversity, respect human rights, improve farmer livelihoods, and mitigating our impacts and exposure to climate change. We understand that without embracing Positive Agriculture, our ability to source the necessary ingredients for our products is in jeopardy, as is the world’s ability to reliably access safe and healthy foods.  Positive Agriculture is a key pillar under our pep+ sustainability strategy that will transform how we grow and create value, while making a positive impact on the planet and people. The Global Sustainable Agriculture Sr Analyst will play a critical role supporting this transformation within the Global Sustainability Office.  Key accountabilities include: Coordinate forest-risk landscape impact programs in South East Asia, responsible for day-to-day management and coordination with implementing partners and contributing to the development of new programs where needed, in line with PepsiCo strategy Represent PepsiCo in regional forums and events Support Supplier and Franchise/JV engagement for strategy implementation Support engagement with key internal teams, including Government Affairs, Procurement, Franchise/JVs and the Global Sustainability Team Support the development of a monitoring and reporting frameworks for landscape initiatives Act as a key source of intelligence on the ground to inform global forest-risk strategy development Capture and share learnings from landscape initiatives to inform the broader strategy and future initiatives we undertake Qualifications/Requirements 3-5 years experience in Environmental, Engineering, Env Sciences, Agriculture or related field Bachelor’s Degree in Agriculture, Environmental or Engineering/Sciences required Experience in business risk assessment, business continuity planning and/or sustainability risk assessment Experience with palm oil, forestry or related industries in the region (candidates with private sector experience preferred) Familiarity with legal and political context relating to forest-related commodities Excellent skills in data analysis and in identifying and communicating data insights Strong project management skills Stakeholder engagement and collaboration skills Fluency in Bahasa Indonesia and English (written and spoken). Additional regional languages an advantage. Ability to work remotely/independently, proactively and with a high degree of automony Experience working with Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies a plus but not required Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation Job Type: Regular

title: Supply and Inventory Planning Analyst
description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s animal nutrition and health business, where we improve lives through better nutrition. Our team researches, innovates and creates solutions that deliver healthy results for our customers. Job Purpose and Impact  The Supply and Inventory Planning Analyst will help coordinate long term supply chain strategies across networks to address capacity issues and production location decisions in support of business goals. In this role, you will monitor key integrated business planning performance indicators, cost to serve performance data and help coordinate cross functional work teams to meet high customer service standards. Key Accountabilities  Handle production schedule in respective location to support on demand plan including capacity, constraint, & operational requirement Maintain data relevant to network distribution planning activities including capacity, constraint, logistics, supplier, master and location data. Participate in generating and executing cycle and safety stock plans for the assigned product or location, using the approved supply plan inputs. Help develop gap coverage plans during inventory shortages. Help create requirements plan and long term supply plan for assigned products and locations as input for the integrated business planning cycle. Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience Other minimum qualifications may apply Preferred Qualifications Have 3 years experience in Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain, preferable in Production Planning Pro-active, able to mitigate problem Good communication skill, able to synchronize multiple stakeholders  Cargill highly encourages vaccinations but does not mandate at this time. Upon hire, you will be asked to provide your vaccination status, and if unvaccinated or if you choose not to disclose, you would be expected to follow Cargill’s safety protocols for unvaccinated employees (i.e., mask mandates, and social distancing).  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

title: Analyst
description: Requisition ID 9078 Country Indonesia State/Province Jakarta Raya City Jakarta About Us Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people. Our 10,000 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions: Organizational Strategy Assessment and Succession Talent Acquisition Leadership Development Total Rewards Job description Position Summary The Analyst position is responsible for supporting the effective running of bids, account planning, projects and/or client engagements providing, performing general research and analysis as required. This is typically the entry level for junior candidates with little or no previous business experience. The main focus is on delivery, generally under guidance and supervision and is predominantly desk/office based. Individuals will be developing an understanding of Korn Ferry (KF) Advisory tools, techniques and offerings. Although not directly accountable for business development, role holders will support the business development efforts of others through basic research, coordination and administration. Primary Responsibilities Deliver high quality work that meets expectations for timeliness, accuracy and completeness. Apply, as directed, the work procedures or approaches needed to address technical challenges in the project. Carry out secondary research, analyze and manipulate data and produce reports to provide understanding and insights for a project or sector team. Perform basic client research, pulling client information, formatting proposals, under direction. Support the project/bid manager in ensuring that options are priced appropriately, contracts are clearly drafted and agreed and that invoices are raised and paid according to agreed schedules. Operate effectively as part of a bid, project or sector team to cooperate and exchange information efficiently. Share transactional information, answer basic questions regarding data or reports, share and request data. May comment on and interpret analyses/data for clients directly to further project objectives and/or the relationship with KF Advisory. Contact will be remote via telephone or email and after approval by the project leader. Attend relevant training courses and seek opportunities to extend knowledge beyond a particular practice or service line. Is developing an understanding of a range of standard KF Advisory analytical processes and related protocols, templates, and tools generally within a defined service line or area of expertise. Is developing an understanding of KF Advisory clients, generally on a sector basis. PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS Some previous business experience preferred but not essential. A bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification   Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/ Veteran. description: The Client Onboard Analyst 2 is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.  Responsibilities: Responsible for customer interaction, documentation issuance, review and system setups. Demonstrates high level of diligence, motivation and organizational skills. Focuses on timely and accurate delivery of all account opening functions, as well as delivering superior customer service and resolution of customer issues. Performs day to day management of the account opening and maintenance processing, including daily management of in-process, pended, and service related activities, ensuring account opening requirements are clearly defined to support all scenarios of account opening and maintenance requirements, to include delivery of very high quality service to customers and internal partners. Responsible for various types of project management in the account services space, and managing cross-functional relationships with all teams. Determines new work procedures, analyzes complex and variable issues with significant departmental impact. Consistent delivery of high quality service to customers through meeting or exceeding customer expectation guided by service level agreements and efficiency/accuracy standards. Ensures awareness and full compliance of internal processes, regulations, policies, guidelines, procedures, and practices. Establishes and maintains close working relationship with clients and within team to facilitate an open and direct communication of issues, needs, queries, etc., in such that these may be responded to in an efficient, prompt and professional manner. Embarks on continuous on the job training for end to end product knowledge. Understands client requirements and implement them correctly. Understands new customer requirements and ensure adequate support to new customer requirements and initiatives. Monitors customer satisfaction and service level and drive process changes. Provides innovative solutions to clients. Daily deliverable of routine and defined tasks, while developing knowledge of the broader context in which work is being performed. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 0-2 years of experience in Documentation review, Account Maintenance and related Cash products preferred. Demonstrated interpersonal skills, pro-active team player but also able to work independently, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Highly motivated, persistent, and able to work in a structured, high volume, time sensitive, high-risk environment. Capable of multitasking and eager to learn multiple products in a challenging environment. Fast learner, strong attention to detail, and willingness to go extra mile. Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications. Proficient in handling urgent and escalation cases and manage client and internal team expectations. Proficient knowledge of English (written and spoken). title: PAC Performance Data Analyst
description: About the Role  This role will support the Performance team to analyze performance data and create and recommend key actionable insights to enhance the impact of performance review cycles. The ideal candidate should be skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.  What You Will Do Will play a key role as the responsible data person to support the Performance team across all annual cycles Provide clean data sets prior the cycle, and data modeling to empower stakeholders to answer their questions regarding the performance Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources Designing, developing, implementing and managing key metrics and enabling analytics dashboard in monitoring performance deliverables. Ensuring all data displayed at any time on the dashboard is updated and correct Coordinate and collaborate with multiple teams prior the performance cycle to ensure the Performance process runs smoothly pre and post cycle Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity Solving data and tools issues Monitoring performance ticketing system What You Will Need Strong foundation in data query/manipulation using SQL and PostgreSQL and data visualization using tools like Google Bigquery, and Google Data Studio Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization Results driven and detail-oriented, with strong intuition on how to solve problems Motivated to learn something new in order to support the teams across Gojek Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Strong organizational and time management skills About the Team  Working in PAC is always a dynamic environment - definitely never a dull day. If you like to be exposed to challenging and exciting projects and deadlines this is the place to be. We are a multicultural bunch, from all across Indonesia, Singapore, India full of people doing their best for their colleagues. We have lots of meetings and a lot of chat about weird hobbies.  About Gojek  Gojek is a Super App. It is one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and a dozen other products. We are Indonesia’s first decacorn. We are also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'  Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business, and MSMEs.  As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion in annualized gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Vietnam, and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia (outside of China) and is the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.  Gojek contributed IDR 249 T to the Indonesian economy (equivalent to 2% of Indonesia's GDP in 2020). As of Q1 2021, the Gojek App witnessed over 190mn downloads by customers. The platform has over 2mn Driver Partners & ~900000 Merchant Partners across SEA.  About GoTo Financial  GoTo Financial brings secure, reliable, and user-friendly financial solutions to over 55 million monthly active users, more than 14 million merchants, and over 2.5 million driver-partners eager to benefit from the digital economy in the GoTo ecosystem.  GoTo Financial’s consumer services include GoPay, GoPayLater, and other financial services. We also serve businesses of all sizes through leading payment gateway Midtrans, Indonesia’s largest cloud POS network Moka and GoKasir. We also have the all-in-one merchant solution GoBiz, GoBiz Plus, GoStore, and Selly - available in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.  Gojek and GoTo Financial are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

title: CRM Analyst
description: This role is based in Indonesia and will be part of the Lifecycle, Engagement & Retention team. The Lifecycle, Engagement & Retention team is driving engagement and retention across owned channels as well as optimizing user journey and experience. As the CRM Analyst, you will be responsible for advising on next best actions and innovations to drive engagement and retention, and lending support and advice on the forecasting & reporting of CRM team performance in Indonesia.  The Walt Disney Company’s Direct-To-Consumer and International (DTCI) is a global business segment with the mission of providing consumers around the world access to the content they want most, on the latest platforms, at a time of rapidly evolving consumer habits. Combining the Company’s direct-to-consumer streaming services, Hulu, ESPN+ and Disney+ alongside Disney’s international media businesses, DTCI aligns cutting-edge technology with world-class content and beloved brands to expand the Company’s global footprint and deliver highly-personalized entertainment experiences to diverse consumers around the world.    Responsibilities :  Understand factors that positively or negatively contribute to sales, engagement and retention performance and identify action plans to grow Monitor and identify opportunities, title: Budgeting and Reporting Analyst
description: Job Description: Life at Grab At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the team Budget and Reporting role is part of GrabMart Strategy and Planning team, which is a young, established, long standing team responsible for tailoring business strategy to to grow GrabMart business in every aspect. We make an impact by expanding the business thus helping the ecosystem to beneﬁt from it. Our team is made up of people with a growth mindset, data-driven, open mind and can do attitude yet still having fun . If you are looking for an opportunity to grow yet contributing to solving problems and the success of those small & medium businesses, then you should join our team! Get to know the role The role is a balance of advanced analytics and stakeholder management - leading day-to-day budget and financial performance coordination with related parties i.e., Marketing team, Operations team, Demand Growth Team, Category Team, while growing using data analyses to gain actionable insight (e.g., promo & incentive optimization, new revenue stream, merchant productivity, etc.) and working with cross-functional teams to drive execution. The Day-to-Day Activities: Act as the key finance partner for the sub-business team, city team and other supporting team Own the forecasting and budgeting process Independently build the financial model and templates Responsible for reporting and follow up analysis towards performance, budget and forecast, both for overall Business performance, category breakdown performance, and city level performance Drive business profitability and growth by analyzing revenues and costs as well as new initiatives and business cases Proactively do deep dive or trend analysis to come up with recommendation to business Lead project(s) and be the agent of change and improvement Be adaptive and take on other areas or initiatives as required The Must-Haves: Strong combination of business and operational hands on skills, get things done Excellent excel knowledge and forecast model building SQL is a plus Financial mindset and easy to translate business questions into financial analysis Independent work and driving ahead Good communication and presentation skills Strong integrity and not afraid to raise concern or opportunity Possibly background in retail/start-up, and/or other finance/data driven role Our Commitment We recognize that with these individual attributes come different workplace challenges, and we will work with Grabbers to address them in our journey towards creating inclusion at Grab for all Grabbers. About Grab Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries. Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

title: Data Science Analyst
description: Job Description  ABOUT THIS JOB At Nielsen, our obsession to have high quality data from Consumer Insights operational execution is what we‘re doing every day. Every member of this team work in collaborative way to ensure data that we get from respondent is valid and has been followed standard operating procedure. Working together across functions, our Consumer Insight Data Science’s team looks and analyzes the data, so that the result will give insight to field and quality control team for them to evaluate the performance of their resources. RESPONSIBILITIES Fieldwork and Quality Control (key responsibilities) Execute and delivering Data Quality Analysis report and trend analysis report Working closely with QC / Field / PM / CS Team on the following throughout the fieldwork period Set up thresholds of key variables for quality monitoring Addressing outliers flagged from data quality analysis report Collaborate with CS and Operations team to investigate and review field execution in case of data irregularities Overall owner of Data Science activities for the market / cluster Custodian of market SOPs related to methodology, sampling, and QC Partner with CS to interpret data changes especially for tracking study. A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU Common research methodology and data analysis are second nature to you. Optimizing research design and execution? You’re up for that, too. You’ve honed your tech skills alongside your people skills and can work closely with other teams as well as you lead your own. You’re ready to put your experience to work and take ownership of projects on a global scale—after all, you’re fluent in English language. You’re ready for what’s next. QUALIFICATIONS 1-2 years in market research industry Average-level knowledge of statistics Average-level knowledge of data interpretation - ability to explain variance related to fieldwork variances and / or market dynamics Good communication skills Ability to implement Data Science SOPs relevant to market Good English proficiency Proficient in Microsoft Office tools   Additional Information  About NielsenIQ NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com. NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description: Life at Grab At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the team The GrabFood Demand Planning Strategy team is an established team responsible for strategizing demand and growth strategy for GrabFood Indonesia. If you are someone who is passionate in the area of strategy and data analysis yet do not hesitate to roll up your sleeves in order to make things happen then you should join our team! Get to know the role We are looking for a Data Analyst to drive analysis in order for us to find opportunities by measuring initiative results, providing insights, and solving problems. The Day-to-Day Activities You will work with large data sets and derive business recommendations through compelling statistical evidence-based research and visualization. Run SQL queries, provide reports or updates Define key metrics to evaluate the health of our business teams & programs Discover & drive program initiatives through data driven recommendations and partner with cross-functional teams to implement/launch them Manage data models to bring order and insight to complex data sets Leverage existing Python abstractions and/or other visualization tools to design and develop new user-facing tools & dash-boarding systems to empower partner teams Communicate findings from data and analyses to stakeholders, influencing them to make the best decisions possible Design market intelligence metrics and performance measurement dashboards for GrabFood Develop frameworks to analyze business problems, develop hypotheses, mine data, deliver recommendations, and assess impact of proposed solutions Perform analysis & research plans to support decision making process The Must-Haves Bachelor's or master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics), or equivalent experience. Advanced written and spoken English 2-3 years of work experience in consulting or a technology-related analytical role Curiosity and passion for Grab Strong analytical skills, with experience solving ambiguous problems using data and providing practical business insights Strong process-oriented skills and drive to find the most efficient way to do things without sacrificing a high quality of work and/or results Proficiency in SQL & Excel Ability to partner cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, operations, product management, and/or sales Familiarity with Python or a similar scripting language for analytical contexts is a plus Experience in working with large data sets and distributed computing tools (Presto, Athena) is a plus Experience in building dashboard with visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI/ Tableau is a plus Our Commitment We recognize that with these individual attributes come different workplace challenges, and we will work with Grabbers to address them in our journey towards creating inclusion at Grab for all Grabbers. Pro-actively identify and analyze peak days and shoulder days taking into consideration past performance as well as new industry trends. Clearly communicate strategic vision and objectives to all Sales Team Leads on how to drive revenues and improve performance. Proactively identify soft spot/need periods for RevPAR/CM management; work in cooperation with PM/ Sales/Marketing, as well as regional and corporate resources. Create and share reports and Dashboards to help in decision making.

title: Analyst, Indonesia
description: Who We Are BowerGroupAsia, Inc. (BGA) is the preeminent government affairs and public policy advisory firm supporting the world’s leading multinational companies in the Indo-Pacific. With 26 offices in Asia, BGA staff provide services to clients in 28 markets across the region. We seek a talented, highly motivated Analyst to join our Indonesia team based in Jakarta. The candidate should be motivated to help the world’s premier companies understand Indonesia, find alignment with customers, communities and key stakeholders and help Indonesia evolve by considering the ideas and capabilities of top tier companies that want to invest in Indonesia. Position Responsibilities Manage a portfolio of clients with a focus on the Indonesian market by doing the following: Ensure the high-quality, actionable and timely presentation of deliverables that meet the demanding needs of BGA clients, including in-person and virtual briefings, written memos and reports, presentations, stakeholder maps and other necessary deliverables. Analyse and interpret the business, investment and political implications of specific government regulations, policies and laws. Keep abreast of news relevant to clients, gather intelligence and provide top-line analysis of current events and how developments affect clients’ business operations. Map and engage public and private-sector stakeholders, civil society, the media and other influencers. Build and nurture networks with clients and corporate executives, government officials, media and civil society experts, and represent BGA before those constituencies as needed. Work collaboratively with BGA teams based in Indonesia and elsewhere in Asia, the Pacific and North America, on a range of projects and provide further support internally and externally to advance BGA objectives. Job Requirements This position combines high-level client relations with the skills and responsibilities required for building relationships with key interlocutors in the market. The ability to interact effectively both inside the company and externally, while remaining flexible, proactive and efficient is crucial to this role. The ideal candidate can work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively as a team player in high-pressure situations. The ideal applicant can effectively manage multiple work streams while meeting deadlines and should be highly self-motivated, well organized, detail oriented and collegial. She or he should feel comfortable interacting with a range of interlocutors and should enjoy the various challenges of supporting large multinational corporations operating in the Asia-Pacific. Qualifications Professional experience in the government affairs, public policy, consulting or industry expertise relevant to Indonesia Demonstrated experience in or passion for one or more of the following industries: healthcare and pharmaceuticals, information and communications technology, financial services, natural resources, and others. Outstanding written and verbal communications skills in English and Bahasa Indonesia along with an aptitude for public speaking and project presentations. A keen understanding of Indonesia’s evolving regulatory environment and how to navigate it on behalf of multinational companies. Ability to engage confidently and thoughtfully with corporate government affairs representatives, as well as Indonesian and foreign government officials, civil society and the media. Proficiency in Microsoft Office software and ability to learn and adopt new technologies. Previous experience using Salesforce is a plus. Education: Minimum bachelor’s degree, master’s degree is preferred. This position is based in Jakarta and reports to the Managing Director and Deputy Managing Director. Applicants should send a cover letter explaining their suitability for the position and CV to Douglas Ramage (dramage@bowergroupasia.com). NOTE: When you apply for a position through our website, you consent to provide personal information to BowerGroupAsia to process such information in order to properly evaluate your potential employment. Such personal information may include, but is not limited to, your name, email address, date of birth, qualifications, experience, employment history and skills. The security of your personal information is important to us, but please remember that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100 percent secure. While BowerGroupAsia strives to use acceptable means to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. BowerGroupAsia takes all appropriate measures consistent with applicable privacy and data security laws and regulations to protect personal information. By submitting your information for a position with BowerGroupAsia, you consent for BGA to share your personal information with limited third parties, including hiring personnel with authorized access, and third-party service providers appointed by and acting on behalf of BowerGroupAsia. This includes personal information that will be available to third party companies that provide BowerGroupAsia with employee applicant selection services. Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst - Financial Services
description: About the Role  As a Data Analyst on the Financial Services Platform, you will be responsible to utilize our voluminous data to improve acquisition, activation, retention, and loyalty for our product. You will be driving the analytics projects of the Growth team across different products, ultimately enabling the Financial Services team to make data-driven decisions.   What You Will Do Optimize and automate solutions by leveraging Data Sciences & Data Engineers resources Analyze our complex and ever-growing data, present insights, and propose strategic options to senior management to drive business decisions Maintain rigor in analytical excellence in terms of data warehousing, dashboarding, and data analytics Oversee analytics projects across the products to ensure that best practices are being leveraged and business questions are answered Drive analytics projects—spanning across products—that improve efficiency and quality, such as automation or other shared analytical tools (sample size calculators) leveraging scripting languages such as R or Python Liaise with other analytical chapters within the Financial Services Platform as well as across Gojek such as Data Science, Data Engineering, Data Governance, Risk Analytics, etc, to ensure that initiatives are aligned and data integrity standards are adhered to What You Will Need BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Engineering, Business, or equivalent experience Should have at least 2 years of working experience in an analytical role (data analyst, BI, data science, statistician, etc) Strong project management skill to manage complex projects; also can manage and prioritize multiple internal and external stakeholders Strong business acumen and analytical thinking. Comfortable translating high-level business requirements into structured analytical steps Advanced SQL skills with expertise in either Excel/Python/R Comfortable solving problems and telling stories with data Understand basic data warehouse design and familiar with at least one BI tool (Tableau, Power BI, etc) Understand basic A/B testing design & analysis About the Team    The Financial Services stream at Gojek is passionate about empowering our users with the tools to be financially responsible. The Growth team, currently consisting of 6 members, is at the center of the stream's Go-To-Market and strategy decisions, where we help direct the product towards the right solutions by tackling the right problems through exploratory data analyses and rapid experimentation. Imagine a blend of data analysis, marketing, statistical testing, and product management; that sweet spot is where we're at. We're a team that's always willing to get our hands dirty, meaning we're responsible for analyzing, designing, and also executing because we believe that high impact comes from high accountability. If you're a data whiz who enjoys the collaborative nature of solving business problems, then you might be our person.  About Gojek  Gojek is a Super App. It is one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and a dozen other products. We are Indonesia’s first decacorn. We are also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'  Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business, and MSMEs.  As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion in annualized gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Vietnam, and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia (outside of China) and is the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.  Gojek contributed IDR 249 T to the Indonesian economy (equivalent to 2% of Indonesia's GDP in 2020). As of Q1 2021, the Gojek App witnessed over 190mn downloads by customers. The platform has over 2mn Driver Partners & ~900000 Merchant Partners across SEA.  About GoTo Financial  GoTo Financial brings secure, reliable, and user-friendly financial solutions to over 55 million monthly active users, more than 14 million merchants, and over 2.5 million driver-partners eager to benefit from the digital economy in the GoTo ecosystem.  GoTo Financial’s consumer services include GoPay, GoPayLater, and other financial services. We also serve businesses of all sizes through leading payment gateway Midtrans, Indonesia’s largest cloud POS network Moka and GoKasir. We also have the all-in-one merchant solution GoBiz, GoBiz Plus, GoStore, and Selly - available in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.  Gojek and GoTo Financial are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Pricing & Data Specialist
description: Grocery shopping is easy, said no one ever! Nobody likes cardio in the supermarket, looking for an empty parking bay, lining up and, God forbid, traffic jams. There is more to life than just reaching for that loaf of bread on the top shelf at the store. Enter the solution!  We are HappyFresh, Southeast Asia’s leading grocery e-commerce company that is hell-bent on delivering a simplified life by revolutionizing how you and many households get their groceries.  Our HappyFresh app grants access to over 400 partnered supermarkets and specialty stores that echo our cause to change the grocery shopping landscape. Customers can also shop from our HappyFresh Supermarket, which offers greater shopping flexibility. Enjoy express and scheduled grocery deliveries, fewer out-of-stock moments, competitive prices and more.  We hold through to 5 cultural pillars that serve as our mantra behind our day-to-day tasks and interactions with our teammates, laying the foundation for a more conducive and productive work culture. They are:  1. Customer, Customer, Customer 2. Ownership and Deliver Impact 3. Team Player 4. Openness 5. Self Mastery  Beyond our strive towards solving the problem that is grocery shopping, we look to address the needs and wants of local communities and create a future where groceries will never be a problem in the modern world.   What Will You Do Collect data, buying price, competitors’ pricing, retail prices and vendor’s bills Market intelligence to anticipate in/deflation, key information to anticipate purchase decisions Build and execute a pricing strategy, set selling price to reach targeted margins Daily/weekly/monthly price update (regular & promotion prices) for each dark store Create and maintain reporting for stakeholders with key metrics Provide analysis on price elasticity & sensitivity Provide assortment analysis per category and sub-category, suggest In/Out item lists Stock analysis with action plans in partnership with Demand planning & Buyer teams Favour good coordination with commercial and other internal stakeholders’ teams What Will You Need Minimum 3-5 years of working experience as business analyst, data analyst, accounting, data statistic or IT Having experience in FMCG, Food, Retail Business or E-commerce Experience with start-up journey is also a plus Organized, able to simplify & synthetize complex data streams in a clear manner Expert in Excel/Google sheet (Pivot, Vlookup, SQL), Tableau & reporting tools; tech savvy Ability to multitasking and learn quickly Super attention to details and result oriented Customer focused mindset and thrive in a fast-paced environment Able to work remotely when required, self-motivated, creative & entrepreneurial attitude Ability to effectively converse and write in English for collaborations at group level Willing to work extra miles & can-do attitude. What's In It for You HappyFit: fun exercise programs alongside professional trainers. HappyMind: free psychological consultation to keep your mental health on track. HappyBenefit: allowance for health activities and health-related items. LinkedIn Learning access for all courses! Discounts on grocery shopping on our HappyFresh app. Competitive compensation package including medical, dental, maternal insurance and more. No Meeting Thursday: an internal initiative for HappyFreshers to engage in deeper work task focus without distractions. Additional 1 day annual leave for each work anniversary. Birthday leave. Occasional celebration for team engagements. All-access to snacks in our pantry. Hybrid working environment with dynamic and international colleagues. What Will You be Part of  Meet, collaborate, and flex your skills alongside talented and driven problem solvers from all walks of life. We applaud a hungry-to-learn and a proactive attitude in helping other HappyFreshers within and beyond your departmental borders in their time of need. All while striving for the same goal - to deliver a simplified life.  We place safety for HappyFreshers first. Hence why, we take extensive measures to ensure you stay safe and healthy in body, mind, and soul through our various online and offline activities.  See what it's like to work here: http://happyfresh.com/careers

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Advocate data-informed decision-making across business depts.  Proactive on ad-hoc/deeper data-investigations or trend-analysis to uncover hidden sources of value within our business, and make recommendations out of it when applicable  Own (create, maintain, monitor) reliable & scalable reports and dashboards across our BI tools (i.e. BigQuery, Tableau, etc)  Understand and able to stitch between behavioural & transactional users’ data in doing forecasting & planning 5+ years work experience in Data/BI related field  Excellent command of SQL, Excel/VBA, Tableau/Power BI. Familiarity with GCP and BQ is a big plus.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Logistics
description: Location Jakarta Work Type Permanent Application Posted April 26, 2022 About the role: Climb on board and fasten your helmet if you're ready to be our Data Analyst. In this role, you will get to build data products with the ability to see the real-time impact of your contribution. You will be modeling and analyzing data, building dashboards, maintaining data quality, and supporting data-driven decision making. You will not be alone in this journey though! We have Product Managers, Engineers, Data Scientists, Business Intelligence, Design, and Business folks that are eager to work with you. company: Micron Semiconductor Asia Operations Pte. Ltd
description: Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.JR27323 Sr. QMS Engineer  Develop and Improve Micron's Quality Management Systems . Drive Micron customer feedback and response program . Administer surveys and analyze best practices for techniques and processes . Support ISO certification efforts . Support internal audit program by conducting ISO9001/TS16949 audits, gap analysis, and corrective action implementation . Research best practices and conduct benchmarking related to QMS processes, methods, and tools . Based upon the overall Quality System performance, identify critical systems or processes where quality improvements are required, initiate projects or activities to analyze, evaluate and propose solutions to address the problem and improve performance Collect and Analyze Data . Analyze data and metrics to develop suggestions for the improvement of processes and the QMS . Collect data to identify root cause of problems . Summarize performance metrics for management review . Develop and maintain corporate quality and functional or process metric dashboards . Develop metrics that provide data for process measurement . Utilize problem-solving methods and tools to solve complex problems Manage and Participate in Projects and Initiatives . Identify and drive Quality Systems projects from initiation to completion . Diagram and model existing processes . Evaluate existing business processes for performance improvement . Plan, perform, and implement process improvement initiatives . Identify and develop systems that support business processes (workflow, data, user interface, etc.) . Organize, lead, or facilitate cross-functional project teams and communicate team progress . Utilize quality methods and tools to drive process improvement & provide consultation . Develop and maintain positive, cooperative, team-oriented relationships with coworkers, supervisors, managers, clients, and others . Maintain knowledge of semiconductor products, processing, failure modes, and reliability mechanisms . Provide consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques or quality improvement methods to improve process performance and product quality . Deliver presentations and training courses including measurement, analysis, improvement, and control . Perform cost and benefit analyses and aid decision making through data analysis, decision analysis, potential problem/opportunity analysis etc. . Provide performance indices . Identify and report against metrics . Manage and resolve issues (obstacles) . Escalate issues as appropriate About Micron Technology, Inc. We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich lifefor all. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron® and Crucial® brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities - from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience. You must collaborate with global automation, key equipment group, site process and equipment engineering, procurement, safety EHS for surfacing opportunities, prioritize key initiatives, collaborating with solution providers, execute the implementation plan, reviewing safety standards. Lead for all integration with smart sensors & IO link, and interface to drive the data and smart analytics. May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.  Brainstorm opportunities and build roadmap on factory automation Build business requirements and establish user acceptance criteria Approve design review on automation solutions Write technical procurement specification (Doc2/TAR) provided to vendors Review and approve ROI analysis methodology  Execute to Plan on Automation Roadmap Establish project plan and publish Gantt chart for progress Steadfast focus on execution and efficiently handle exceptions/ contingency Drive innovation that reaps significant bottom-line benefits Train the workforce on new systems and hardware  Establish performance metrics for automation solution at manufacturing network Ensure solutions meet the requirements on payback analysis published Build & publish metrics related to Host, RMS, Handlers, AMHS and Stocker performance Ensure compliance to material control, data collection and traceability requirements improve the traceability related to product movement Improve automation process on site and support automation related improvement projects from other sites review and drive system performance improvement through CIP program  Education Degree with shown experience in Engineering - prefer Electronics, Mechatronics, Electrical fields Experience Minimum of 5 years work experience in electronics or semiconductor manufacturing environment familiarity with SMT process, product test, handlers, electronic packing is helpful Knowledge on tool design elements and sub-components Familiarity on Standards for safety (SEMI S2, CE, TUV), Ergonomics (SEMI S8), tool automation protocols (SEMI) Excellent interpersonal skills to work across various functional team & various job level Ability to work in both strategic and tactical space driving holistic solutions Experienced in handling automation projects and execution Proficient various PLC logic and basic / advanced software programming (C#, C++) to enhance automation logic, system flow efficiency and / or detection capability. Proficient in schematic diagrams and electronics related field . Good understanding in equipment to system communication protocol . Good knowledge in RF technology will be an added advantage . Familiar with various control systems . Experienced in robotics will be an added advantage . Experienced in test environment will be an added advantage Can Do mentality with tenacious drive for results Highly motivated and possess a positive demeanor. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.JR24555 SENIOR ENGINEER, PDE ENG Description As a Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for Managing the Network Change thru collaboration with cross functional teams from site Process, equipment, PDE, Pkg Rel team, Global and site QE to ensure on compliance to the global change management process and work towards management objectives Responsibilities  Coordinate and manage change request to go to the appropriate change request stage across assembly sites Provide adequate communication of change flow / process/ status when necessary Ensure compliance to site/network change request to go to the appropriate change request stage Governance and alignment of Global Visual defect workmanship specs for substrates Supporting the management in business process risk management and improvement activities Point of contact to analysis and response to external customers request on assembly processes thru working closely with network team and customer facing quality team Requirement  Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering Good Communication and interpersonal social skills and good team player Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent Project management skills Able to manage multi tasks and balance dynamic priorities Ability to participate in a multi-functional team environment About Micron Technology, Inc. title: Process Engineer
description: About Syngenta Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities. About this job: You will provide process engineering expertise to optimize and improve manufacturing processes with focusing on safety, quality, cost effectiveness and responsiveness. As a Process Engineer, you will worked on a specific project with other section heads by providing process overview in Gunung Putri site manufacturing process through data analysis and develop improvement proposal for the implementation.  Accountabilities: Perform detail project feasibility on capex prior quotation which cover PRA, technical documentation, standard engineering document from regional team. Expert on Risk Management & Process Risk Assessment. Improve process on cost reduction for waste on / PM / RM with supply team Management of Change Leader. Lead Lean Manufacturing implementation / kaizen events in site. Analyze new product feasibility for toller product relocation. Maintain effective communication with stakeholders (at country, regional and even global level) regarding process development / improvement initiatives to ensure that all factors are taken into account. Develop awareness of best industry practice through networking with Syngenta functional experts and external sources.  You will bring the following essential knowledge & experience: Chemical Engineering Bachlor degree holder. 4-5 years in manufacturing operation including process design responsibilities. Expert on using AUTOCAD. Engineering project management and capability of managing multiple assignments. Knowledge in Lean Manufacturing Operation. Knowledgeable in Engineering International Standard. Knowledge in piping & instrument diagram & process flow diagram. Experience in process risk assessment for engineering project. In Syngenta we recognize that diversity and inclusion is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation and achieve our business goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect and connection with the communities where we operate – benefitting individual employees and the company. Additional Information: Location: Gunung Putri, Bogor, Indonesia. Full time position.

title: Electrical Engineer
description: Job Description Indonesia A new opportunity has arisen for a skilled Electrical Engineer like you, to oversee and bring expertise to our team. Rolls-Royce Power Systems is headquartered in Friedrichshafen in southern Germany and employs around 9,000 people. The product portfolio includes mtu-brand high-speed engines and propulsion systems for ships, power generation, heavy land, rail and defence vehicles and for the oil and gas industry as well as diesel and gas systems and battery containers for mission critical, standby and continuous power, combined generation of heat and power, and microgrids. At Rolls-Royce, we look beyond tomorrow. We continually pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions to deliver cleaner, safer and more competitive power Key Accountabilities: Implementing and maintaining MTU product electrical quality in all his job responsibility Diagnosing, investigating, and recognizing the engine/product’s electrical problem/trouble and to take a follow up action correctly To evaluate engine/product operating data and engine/product malfunction report in coordination with relevant parties and follow up To coordinate and collaborate with Product Support team regarding technical/electrical issue To travel to the customer site to respond the customer needs/requirements Qualifications and Skills: Degree/Diploma in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Knowledge of ISO 9001 procedures will have an advantage Affiliation with Diesel Engines and/or Power Generation Able to work in Jakarta Office We offer excellent opportunities to develop, along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits.  Pioneer optimum performance. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.  Our People are our Power  We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential. title: Sr Data Engineer
description: Role instructions: Catch the sunrise on the top of Padar Island and see fascinating views of the boundless blue sea. Dive and spot the beauty of colorful fishes, dancing jellyfishes, and unique coral collections in Labuan Bajo. Take selfies with the world’s largest lizard in Komodo Island or build the majestic sandcastle in Pink beach. Guess which country you could possibly do all those enjoyable activities in? Yup, the answer is Indonesia. With over 17,000 islands, Indonesia has many destinations worth exploring.   Are you looking for a new purpose in life? To introduce the beauty of Indonesia to the eyes of the world.   This is the opportunity to make you excited to jump out of bed every morning. Join our mission to make Indonesia a prosperous nation through tourism. title: Data Engineer, CRM Team
company: ZALORA SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE LTD
description: In this role, the Data Engineer at ZALORA will be a part of the Data Sciences Innovation Lab. This team serves as the gatekeepers and curators of the BIG data collected into the Data Warehouse/Data Lake from all aspects of our fashion e-commerce business and support data-driven decision-making. He/she will conduct complex data analysis, continuously evolve management reporting, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.  Responsibilities: Drive the full lifecycle of Data Science projects: from gathering and understanding the end-user needs to implement a fully automated solution. Develop and provision of Data pipelines to enable self-service reports and dashboards. Deploy Machine learning techniques to answer the appropriate business problems using R or Python. Visualize data using Tableau and create repeatable visual analysis for end users to use as tools. Take ownership of the existing BI platforms and maintain the data integrity and accuracy of the numbers and data sources. Know Agile - Scrum project management experience/knowledge - Ability to prioritise, pushback and effectively manage a data product and sprint backlog.  Requirements: 4+ years of experience in building out scalable and reliable ETL/ELT pipelines and processes to ingest data from a variety of data sources, preferably in the ecommerce retail industry. Deep understanding of Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL) , No-SQL Databases (e.g. MongoDB, ElasticSearch) and hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning of MPP databases (e.g. Redshift, BigQuery). Experience with Tableau, Power BI, Superset or any standard data visualization tools. Strong proficiency in writing production-quality code preferable in R/Python, engineering experience with machine learning projects like Time Series Forecasting, Classification and Optimization problems. Experience administering and deploying CI/CD tools (e.g. Git, Jira, Jenkins) Industrialization (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), Workflow Management ( e.g. Airflow, Jenkins, Luigi) in Linux operating system environments. Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results. Knowledge of cloud services like AWS, GCP, Azure would be a huge added advantage. E-commerce / logistics / fashion retail background a bonus.  The ZALORA Story ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month. ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by ZALORA or Global Fashion Group. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry. Review issues within day to day operational processes and come up with actionable solutions. Continue learning and developing new skills, as well as encourage team member's skills development. Build Analysis from the scratch for continuity improvement. Requirements Bachelor’s degree from Industrial Engineering or quantitative major. Understand about lean concept. Strong quantitative analysis and problem-solving skills. Communication skills to engage with business stakeholders to understand their needs and effectively communicate the results. Experienced from Consulting will be a plus. Create and review technical and user-focused documentation for data solutions (data models, data dictionaries, business glossaries, process and data flows, architecture diagrams, etc.).  Solve for complex data integrations across multiple systems.  Collaborate with management, business partners, analysts, developers, architects, and engineers to support data quality efforts.
