title: Head of Business Intelligence - GoPay
description: Location Jakarta Work Type Permanent Application Posted December 20, 2021 About the Role   As the head of Business Intelligence Payments, you'll be the single point of accountability for the Business Intelligence team's deliverables in Payments, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams including Product Managers, Business Strategists, Marketing, Research, and Data Science while driving alignment between the Data team's priorities and business objectives. You will take a hands-on approach in leading the development and deployment of data-driven solutions, working closely with the Data Warehouse team to design, develop, and manage our data warehouse. Your efforts will translate complex business problems across Risk and Growth into workable solutions to enable teams to build, deploy, and scale data solutions   What You Will Do Work closely with key stakeholders to translate complex business problems across Risk and Growth to data-driven solutions Lead advanced data visualization and analytic projects, such as user states, customer segmentation, and RFM to support our rapid business growth Be outcome-driven; everything we do need metrics, and you will define, report, and improve these metrics Build a solid business context to effectively partner and collaborate with many types of stakeholders, including product managers, analysts, data scientists, and leaders from different teams and functions Recruit, hire and train new team members as you grow your BI team. Mentor and develop team’s capabilities and set up learning and development plans for them Continue to strive for innovation. Be aware of developments in this domain, emerging technologies, academic progress, and vendor offerings Deliver the solutions on time and within budget - be execution and delivery driven What You Will Need A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a relevant quantitative field At least 10 years of experience as a data analyst, or in the Business Intelligence or Data Science fields At least 7 years of experience in leading a team Advanced knowledge in SQL (BQ), data visualization, statistics, and data science with proven experience formulating scalable solutions to business problems across Risk and Growth Solid understanding of data warehousing modeling Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills Experience driving projects from inception to completion About the Team Our team likes to see ourselves as what blood is to the brain - constantly supplying the brain with oxygen so it can function properly. Our super team of 25 BI Analysts and Data Warehouses supply data and insights that fuel GTF Payment’s innovations and evolutions. How does one achieve this, you may ask? Through our data products (automated dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools) and continuous collaboration with the folks in the business and product teams. We are in charge of creating foundational customer segmentation, designing automation processes for campaign tracking, and providing regular reports to the leadership team. Anything data-related within the growth, digital inclusion, or risk and fraud is what our team is concerned about✌ But despite how hardworking we may seem, we do know how to have fun, too. As a matter of fact, we select someone from the team to become our ‘Minister of Entertainment’ every month. The honorary person then will decide what fun activities we can do together . This is especially an important tradition for us with WFH becoming more normalized. While we do miss our monthly outings/dinners, thank goodness for the invention of Slack and Zoom calls that keep us feeling close. About Gojek Gojek is a Super App. It is one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and a dozen other products. We are Indonesia’s first decacorn. We are also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.' Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business, and MSMEs. As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion in annualized gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Vietnam, and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia (outside of China) and is the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia. Gojek contributed IDR 249 T to the Indonesian economy (equivalent to 2% of Indonesia's GDP in 2020). As of Q1 2021, the Gojek App witnessed over 190mn downloads by customers. The platform has over 2mn Driver Partners & ~900000 Merchant Partners across SEA. About GoTo Financial GoTo Financial brings secure, reliable, and user-friendly financial solutions to over 55 million monthly active users, more than 14 million merchants, and over 2.5 million driver-partners eager to benefit from the digital economy in the GoTo ecosystem. GoTo Financial’s consumer services include GoPay, GoPayLater, and other financial services. We also serve businesses of all sizes through leading payment gateway Midtrans, Indonesia’s largest cloud POS network Moka and GoKasir. We also have the all-in-one merchant solution GoBiz, GoBiz Plus, GoStore, and Selly - available in Indonesia and Southeast Asia. Gojek and GoTo Financial are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Head of Business Intelligence - Payments
description: Location Jakarta Work Type Permanent Application Posted December 20, 2021 About the Role   As the head of Business Intelligence Payments, you'll be the single point of accountability for the Business Intelligence team's deliverables in Payments, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams including Product Managers, Business Strategists, Marketing, Research, and Data Science while driving alignment between the Data team's priorities and business objectives. You will take a hands-on approach in leading the development and deployment of data-driven solutions, working closely with the Data Warehouse team to design, develop, and manage our data warehouse. Your efforts will translate complex business problems across Risk and Growth into workable solutions to enable teams to build, deploy, and scale data solutions   What You Will Do Work closely with key stakeholders to translate complex business problems across Risk and Growth to data-driven solutions Lead advanced data visualization and analytic projects, such as user states, customer segmentation, and RFM to support our rapid business growth Be outcome-driven; everything we do need metrics, and you will define, report, and improve these metrics Build a solid business context to effectively partner and collaborate with many types of stakeholders, including product managers, analysts, data scientists, and leaders from different teams and functions Recruit, hire and train new team members as you grow your BI team. Mentor and develop team’s capabilities and set up learning and development plans for them Continue to strive for innovation. Be aware of developments in this domain, emerging technologies, academic progress, and vendor offerings Deliver the solutions on time and within budget - be execution and delivery driven What You Will Need A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a relevant quantitative field At least 10 years of experience as a data analyst, or in the Business Intelligence or Data Science fields At least 7 years of experience in leading a team Advanced knowledge in SQL (BQ), data visualization, statistics, and data science with proven experience formulating scalable solutions to business problems across Risk and Growth Solid understanding of data warehousing modeling Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills Experience driving projects from inception to completion About the Team Our team likes to see ourselves as what blood is to the brain - constantly supplying the brain with oxygen so it can function properly. Our super team of 25 BI Analysts and Data Warehouses supply data and insights that fuel GTF Payment’s innovations and evolutions. How does one achieve this, you may ask? Through our data products (automated dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools) and continuous collaboration with the folks in the business and product teams. We are in charge of creating foundational customer segmentation, designing automation processes for campaign tracking, and providing regular reports to the leadership team. Anything data-related within the growth, digital inclusion, or risk and fraud is what our team is concerned about✌ But despite how hardworking we may seem, we do know how to have fun, too. As a matter of fact, we select someone from the team to become our ‘Minister of Entertainment’ every month. The honorary person then will decide what fun activities we can do together . This is especially an important tradition for us with WFH becoming more normalized. While we do miss our monthly outings/dinners, thank goodness for the invention of Slack and Zoom calls that keep us feeling close.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  We are looking to hire passionate and energetic individuals who can take high degree of ownership and deliver resuts for OYO in this new market:  Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.  Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.  Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.  Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.  Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.  Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.  Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.  Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends.  Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making.  Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes.  Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.  Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issue. QUALIFICATIONS  Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Computer Science/Information Technology, Mathematics, Quantity Survey or equivalent.  Required language(s): English  At least 3-5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.  Required Skill(s): phyton, SQL, Tableau  Preferably Supervisor/Coordinator specialized in IT/Computer - Software or equivalent.

title: Product Management, ShopeePay
description: About The Team  The Payment team, best known for their flagship product: ShopeePay, aims to develop a mature, world-class payment platform connecting individuals and businesses within Shopee ecosystem. Beyond ShopeePay, the Team also connects with a large number of local financial institutions to serve billions of Shopee and SeaMoney users across the different markets.  Together, we aim to reach the forefront of cashless payment technology by providing a more accessible, secure and reliable payment network that empowers individuals as well as micro, small and medium enterprises around the globe.   Job Description: Define and drive product strategy by building product roadmap to achieve product goals Build product solutions for both internal and external end-users Initiate, analyze, propose and launch new product ideas (product development) Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, and product requirement documents Analyse product performance and identify opportunities to improve existing products Oversee and work closely with business teams to support product launches and go-to-market plan Conduct market intelligence to maintain competitiveness and profitability of product offering Work closely with Software Engineers, QA Engineers and Designer on feature and UI/UX implementations   Job Requirements: Bachelor or Master Degree from a reputable University with outstanding academic achievement Has at least 4 years experience in Product Management role Good communication in both spoken and written forms Able to communicate complex business or technical information effectively Good analytical and logical thinking skills Strong ownership and team spirit Good collaboration skills to work with cross-function teams Demonstrated a track record of getting things done in a fast-paced environment

title: Data Analyst & Business Intelligence
description: Bekerja sama dengan Business User dalam merancang report dan dashboard. Membuat dashboard dan report sesuai dengan kebutuhan perusahaan menggunakan BI Tools. Membantu tim membuat report. Membantu tim membuat analisa dan insight. Memaintain report yang sudah ada. Melakukan presentasi report & hasil analisa kepada Business User dan Management.    Requirements Pendidikan Min. S1 Sisteem Informasi. Memiliki 3 tahun pengalaman di posisi yang sama     Benefits Gaji pokok Asuransi Kesehatan

title: Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst
description: About The Role  You are responsible for looking out on the external threat landscape and supporting ongoing investigations using a wide variety of open, commercial and private intelligence sources and converting these to actionable, timely, accurate and objective Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) reports that takes the context of the intelligence consumer strongly into consideration.  What You Will Do Observe: Monitor the surface, deep, darkweb, listen to your intelligence sharing circles. Analyze: Through understanding of the internal landscape assess the (predicted threat). Report: Communicate timely, simply and effectively the threat and key recommendations.  What You Will Need Hard Skills: Strong technical foundation in IT, Networking or Cyber Security (bachelor degree or higher). 5-7 Years of working experience prefered (strong medior or senior in cyber security) Extensive working experience in the Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) field is prefered, candidates from the following affiliated fields are alternatively also preferred: SOC, Penetration Testing or DFIR. Working experience with one or multiple categories of tools (open source or commercial): Link Analysis Tools, Threat Modeling Tools, (Threat) Feed Aggregators, Threat Intelligence Platforms, Digital Risk Protection platforms, Malware Sandboxes, SOAR, SIEM or EDR. Knowledge of: CTI Standards: TAXII, STIX, OpenIOC, SIGMA, SNORT, YARA etc. Threat Modeling: MITRE ATT&CK, Kill chain, Diamond Model or others. Key models: Traffic Light Protocol, Pyramid of Pain, Analysis of Competing Hypotheses (ACH) Darkweb Landscape: Popular dark web marketplaces, forums and communication channels. General Threat Actors: Common TTP’s among categories of threat actors like Script kiddies, Cyber Criminals, Insider threats or Nation State attackers. Regional Threat Actors: Common threat actors active in the region and their TTP’s. Soft Skills: Language: High amount of English written and communicative proficiency required. Cyber Security Jargon: Understanding and ability to clearly make distinctions between risk, threats, probabilities, business impact and controls. Critical Thinking: A scientific way of thinking that prefers evidence and facts as underpinnings of an analytical conclusion and recommendations. Context grasp: Ability to read a CMDB and understand the complete internal landscape. Abstract Thinking: Ability to think on an Operational, Tactical and ideally on a Strategic analytical level in regards to writing a Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) report. Reporting Skills: Reporting: Ability to write reports that are easy to understand and to the point. Audience: Ability to write reports for C-Level Readers that focuses on business impact.. Concise: Ability to write specific and concise reports that gets to the point. Risk: Ability to translate cyber threats descriptions to clear and simple risk language. To the point: Ability to take a 50 page cyber threat landscape report and distill it down to 5 action items that are relevant to the business. Formatting: Attention to detail with regards to bold, cursive, font typeface, font size and visual reporting appearance translating to quality reporting and enhanced readability for consumers.  About The Team  The Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Team’s Mission “To support GoTo’s business and security functions decision making, to help reduce the effectiveness of cyber threats before they attack or while they are attacking.”  CTI Analysts are like the CIA of the organization, they hear, know and see everything. They are instrumental in strategic decision making on the cyber battlefield. With their razor-sharp analysis they can make a game-changing impact in terms of ensuring the cyber security of GoTo’s employees and customers.

title: Business Development Manager - Forensic Investigations and Intelligence
description: In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus. with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.   Kroll consistently provides firms with the professional investigative consulting expertise necessary to resolve conflict through fact-finding and critical analysis. We have conducted thousands of investigations worldwide and have an unmatched track record of resolving disputes and working with in-house and external counsel to successfully conduct and conclude internal, regulatory and other inquiries. Our experts help organizations with their critical fact finding when they need to conduct internal investigations or to examine allegations of wrongdoing. Whether or not actual misconduct is discovered, such inquiries, and their aftermath, can pose serious risks to companies and their stakeholders, damaging their reputation, disrupting their business operations and exposing them to government scrutiny, as well as to potential criminal, civil and regulatory liability. Kroll's investigative services and expertise have helped clients successfully resolve investigations promptly and with minimal business disruption. At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll. Responsibilities: Business Development: Identifying and targeting new client groups and developing a convincing and credible pitch to develop Kroll’s Japanese client base in Indonesia. There will be an expectation that the candidate is a confident speaker and can credibly present the Kroll services and brand, in order to build a pipeline of projects and grow the current revenue. Target and prospect Japanese client decision makers Identify and develop new opportunities (leads) for Japan Desk. Broaden scope of business with existing corporate contacts and network; Provide product/service demonstrations and advise potential clients of our value-add and lead to achievement of revenue goals business model; Keep abreast of new market trends and methods and identify and win cross-sell opportunities; Work with marketing resources to create effective localized marketing materials and to help organize and conduct marketing events that lead to revenue opportunities;   Case work in Southeast Asia; It is critical that the incumbent learn how to handle a broad range of primarily forensic investigation and intelligence projects. This requires dealing with the client; developing a methodology; directing and managing in-house and external resources; analysis; report reviewing/editing. All projects need to be commercially viable. Hence the ability to review and understand P/L is important. Project teams are frequently international and multi-functional, so transparency and coordinated team work are vital.   Requirments: Having experience in sales of professional services Working experience at Japanese corporate environment Strong understanding of the Indonesian ecosystem with insights on political, economic, regulatory and risk dynamics Demonstrate exemplary written and oral communication skills in Japanese and English to communicate effectively particularly with Japanese clients in the region as well as in Japan Experienced in contract preparation, review and execution Excellent relationship building skills and the ability to establish trust and credibility across the organization as well as external clients Strong ability to influence across multiple business lines Must be flexible, enthusiastic and possess good human relations skills Willingness to travel actively   The role requires a high level of organisational ability, excellent verbal and written communication skills, an ability to think strategically and be commercially focused, an analytical mind and an ability to build relationships.   In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.   Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit. #LI-Remote

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description: Job Description: Design, develop & maintaining business intelligence solution for our customer. Gather requirements and manage clients’ expectations on project delivery and product capabilities. Lead & guide team members in projects. Write documentation and conduct training related with BI projects. Interfacing on-site directly with customers, working with clients’ personnel and ABeam consultants.   Job Requirements: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor Degree in Information Technology from reputable University with minimum GPA 3.00. At least 3 full project lifecycle experience (from analysis, design, development, test and support) of new BI projects using common implementation methodology. Prefer candidate with BI (Power BI) products certification. Having experience with other BI Tools (Tableau, Qlikview) will be an advantage. Strong knowledge in SQL and experience with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Sybase, etc.). Hands-on development capability including user interface and scripts development. Fluent in data modeling. Experience in conducting training. Self-starter, pro-active, and work independently with minimum supervision. Organized, meticulous and detail-oriented. Able to perform in a demanding, changing and fast-paced environment. Excellent English communication skills both in verbal and written. Willing to travel.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description: About the Role  If you’re looking to be a part of a dynamic, highly analytical team who enjoys working with data, look no further. As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for the Sales team, you will be building data products to help Sales team achieve its business objectives.As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst in the Sales Ops group, you will be working with the Business and Product teams on supporting analytics (predictive modeling, statistics/data driven analysis) and data products (automated dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools) which will create business impact at scale. The cherry on top: you’ll get to be a part of a team that works to help hundreds of thousands of merchant partners across SE Asia to grow their business!   What You Will Do Owning problem definition and defining them into analytical problems Provide roadmap for complex analytical problem and its technical decision such as library to use/ potential algorithm to use Showcasing impact in a broader business context by providing detailed analysis and data visualization Understand stakeholder needs, respond professionally, and follow up to ensure satisfaction Proactive in developing tools/analysis, and improving business metrics to keep it relevant with company’s growth Partnering with Product Manager and Business teams to help them create data driven decisions Have at least 4 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or other related roles that require strong analytical skills, problem-solving, and business acumen (preferably from payment/ fintech industry) Expert in advanced SQL and data visualization (e.g. Tableau and Metabase) Comfortable working both independently with minimal guidance and in a team setting Ability to use critical thinking to manage daily tasks while being goal-oriented Ability to transform an ambiguous business or product problem into a well-scoped and impactful analysis Have strong statistical knowledge and able to independently select and implement the correct statistical test to answer business questionGood R/Python skills to perform advanced analysis (hypothesis testing, predictive model, clustering, etc) is preferable About the Team    Working in the team : The team consists of 10 people (we call ourselves the Super Ten :D), all came from various professional backgrounds but share a commonality of wanting to create impact at scale. We have great respect towards each other, value open and honest communication, and encourage collaborative efforts.There is flexibility in working hours and locations but we will hold you accountable for the delivery of your KRs and initiativesWe operate through zoom calls (30%), whatsapp (30%), asana and slacks (40%)  Working with your manager : As she quoted, "I encourage heavy alignment in the beginning of every project or term, and do 1 or 2 one on one checkpoints weekly to make sure you are not blocked and are driving in the right direction. Hence, you will have flexibility in your approach, and my role is to make sure that you are supported".    As a team, we’re concerned not only with the growth of the company, but each other’s personal growth and well-being, too; we enjoy bonding over our shared love of Food and Memes (our whatsapp group has the largest collection of Memes!). With WFH becoming more normalized, you best believe we’ve been sharing our favorite ways to prioritize a healthy work-life balance at home  About Gojek  Gojek is a Super App. It is one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and a dozen other products. We are Indonesia’s first decacorn. We are also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'  Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business, and MSMEs.  As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion in annualized gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Vietnam, and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia (outside of China) and is the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.  Gojek contributed IDR 249 T to the Indonesian economy (equivalent to 2% of Indonesia's GDP in 2020). As of Q1 2021, the Gojek App witnessed over 190mn downloads by customers. The platform has over 2mn Driver Partners & ~900000 Merchant Partners across SEA.  About GoTo Financial  GoTo Financial brings secure, reliable, and user-friendly financial solutions to over 55 million monthly active users, more than 14 million merchants, and over 2.5 million driver-partners eager to benefit from the digital economy in the GoTo ecosystem.  GoTo Financial’s consumer services include GoPay, GoPayLater, and other financial services. We also serve businesses of all sizes through leading payment gateway Midtrans, Indonesia’s largest cloud POS network Moka and GoKasir. We also have the all-in-one merchant solution GoBiz, GoBiz Plus, GoStore, and Selly - available in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.  Gojek and GoTo Financial are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Business Development Executive
description: Responsibilities Deliver & manage company sales objective in specific Sub-Area Identify sales growth & opportunity in specific Sub-Area Plan, direct, coordinate, execute & control all sales and promotion activities. Provide effective leadership to his sales team (distributors, promotions girls, event organizer as well as outlet) To come up with innovation to win the targeted market share. Conduct accurate marketing & competitor intelligence to support sales program & strategy. Ensure the correct implementation of advertising and promotion activities in his area in line with the guidelines and directives of marketing. Requirements Bachelor or Master in Business, Marketing or Financial Minimum experience 7 years in FMCG industry Excellent in English both oral & written Has a strong leadership competencies and people development skills Have a good communication, negotiation skills Job Type: Full-time

title: Business Operations & Intelligence Officer
description: Mekari is Indonesia's no. 1 Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company. Our mission is to empower businesses and professionals to progress effortlessly. Our products (Talenta, Jurnal, KlikPajak, & Qontak) have been used by tens of thousands of businesses in Indonesia.   We are looking for a Business Operations & Intelligence Officer with a passion for data, analytics, insights, technology, and operations. You will be part of a team lighting up actionable insights to help the organization make better business decisions. You will drive the next generation BI platform, architect the BI and analytics integration, synthesize, merge and transform the existing BI & reporting capabilities, partner with other teams to enable a world-class support experience and rich insights.   You will build services including real-time and monthly reports, with analysis that can be utilized as the basis for making informed business decisions. Your analysis and planning activities for operations include pipeline, revenue, forecasting, actual and metrics attainment reporting.   You will be able to document data findings, provide details, and present findings with recommendations to management. The individual will enhance the running of reports and automate and standardize each as necessary. The goal is to create one single source of truth when it comes to data reporting.   The position will also involve creation and maintenance of complex spreadsheets as well as BI dashboards and the ability to create reports or presentations from the results. This includes heavy data analysis and research, with the ability to manipulate, analyze, and trend the results.  Responsibilities: Engage broadly with stakeholder teams to structure and prioritize business problems where insights can have the biggest impact. Partner with business team leaders to frame, shape, and execute the critical insights for business decisions. Utilization of critical thinking skills to conceptualize complex business problems and their solutions using advanced analytics on large-scale, real-world business data. Independently execute analytics projects and help our internal teams understand the findings and translate them into action to benefit our Operations. Develop and implement reporting solutions that provide accurate, timely, and effective insight through a performant solution. Ensures availability and provision of relevant revenue, pipeline, and forecast/trending reports and dashboards to management. Visualization of analytic results in a form that is consumable by a diverse set of stakeholders. Create dashboards highlighting business trends for management. Analyze and manage data for metrics for senior management and executives. Supports the establishment of Sales Process rigor and drives related actionable reporting cadence. Relentlessly drive for policy; process and systems optimization opportunities which increases business process efficiency. Deliver consistent results constantly raising the bar on execution excellence delivery and instill a culture of continuous/proactive monitoring of our key financial controls and processes. Establish and operate data quality assurance processes. Be a champion for quality, agility, and process improvement. Show structured thinking skills, planning, and the ability to execute by collaborating and working through others (teammates, leadership teams) and influencing without authority. Respond to ad-hoc reporting requests and prioritizes against competing efforts  Qualifications: A systems thinker, able to manage a high degree of complexity and to distill information into simple messages, able to think both strategically as well as to effectively develop key processes A process mindset where you look to solve a problem every time into the future. Exceptional cross-organizational capabilities, including the ability to partner effectively with senior management, drive complex projects with quality, speed, and agility, build comprehensive and compelling presentation and communication materials that cater to different audiences General understanding of Sales Systems and knowledge domains relevant to specific processes and practices (within their application track) Experience in the Development of CRM Tools such as Zoho CRM & Hubspot, and integrations of RESTful API development & Scripting capabilities. Should have data visualization skills, experience in tools like Power BI, Excel Industry work experience in SQL Databases & queries, implementing statistical models, and analysis (prediction, classification, clustering, time series forecasting, regression models, etc.) Strong skills in process design, case management, workflow, exception management, change management, training, data structure, taxonomy, process automation or other process improvement areas. Attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills, required Demonstrable success in finding solutions in people, tools, and processes. Experience in identifying an issue, investigating, developing a solution, implementing the change, and monitoring the results. Passion for using data and analytics to drive business value BA/BS in finance, operations, computer science, industrial engineering, mathematics, statistics, or other technical/quantitative disciplines   Our team will review your application and will be in touch if your application is shortlisted to the next stage. If you do not hear from us in 30 days, we will keep your resume on file in case a relevant opportunity opens up. We wish you the best. Have a great day

title: Theat Hunting Engineer
description: We are searching for an experienced Threat Hunter that can expertly detect and identify suspicious activity within the network, systems, endpoints, and applications. This will include the identification of complex and advanced persistent threats (APTs), known and unknown threats, including possible zero-day exploits and data leakage. Job Description: Carry out APT and adversary hunting. Conduct behavioral analytics, anomaly monitoring, and threat hunting exercises to identify unknown and suspicious activity that could lead to a cybersecurity incident. Conduct research and analysis on local and worldwide cyber threat streams against our client. Conduct a network and endpoint cybersecurity investigation. Actively monitor known threat actors and adversaries that could be a threat to our client. Job Requirement: Experienced in profiling of threat actors and adversaries' capabilities and Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTP’s). Experienced in gathering and utilizing intelligence from both internal and external sources, extracting indicators of compromise (IOC), suspicious patterns, and malicious Command & Control IP addresses/domains. Having the capability to think like both an attacker and a defender to identify complex and credible cyber threats. Having the capability to utilize various models, including the Cyber Kill Chain, MITRE ATT&CK and Diamond models, Having the capability to identify cyber abnormalities and develop technical and executive investigation reports. Working knowledge of host-based security investigations (Windows, Linux, Network/Security appliances). Working knowledge of operating SIEM and CTI (Cyber Threat Intelligence) solutions and developing use cases. Current understanding of network traffic/packet analysis. Current understanding of operating EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response) systems. (CarbonBlack preferred). Experienced in using Splunk. A candidate must be able to work independently on their own and work during non-business hours. Ability to commute/relocate: Jakarta: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (required) Education: S1 (Preferred) Fluent in English (preferred) Experience: At least 3+ years of experience in cyber threat hunting and/or incident response. License or Certification: Certified in one or more of the following: ECIH, CHFI, CEH, OSCP is preferred Job Type: Full-time Salary: Rp10,000,000 - Rp20,000,000 per month Ability to commute/relocate: Jakarta: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: S1 (Preferred) Experience: Threat Hunting: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Intern
description: Flash Coffee is one of the fastest growing tech-enabled coffee chains in Asia, backed by Rocket Internet, White Star Capital, Delivery Hero-backed DX Ventures, Global Founders Capital, and Conny & Co. We blend an award-winning coffee menu, curated by World Latte Art Champion Arnon Thitiprasert and Indonesian Latte Art Champion Robby Firlian at affordable prices to make great coffee accessible to all. Currently operating in Singapore, Jakarta, Bangkok, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Seoul and Tokyo, Flash Coffee will be opening its doors in other APAC capitals this year, offering an unparalleled customer experience that's powered by technology. What you'll do: Owning the data environment to be used as single source of truth for analysis within the company. Design, build, and maintain data pipeline and data connections to and from external source including but not limited to Vendor API, FTP, and other related external source connections. Work together with the Tech team, to help improve the quality and the structure of the productions data. Liaise with other team to help automate and improve the quality of work from the related team related to to the data. Document the process, the code, the definition, and the structure of the data environment. Maintain the job scheduler to make sure that the data is always available and in perfect quality. Promote a data-driven culture and enforce data governance and security. Who you are: Experienced with SQL and Python is a must Prior internship experience is preferred but not a must Analytical mindset Understanding data warehouse concept What we offer: A vibrant and international team Regular company and team events Being part of a fast-growing startup with a lot of responsibilities from day one

title: Research Analyst, Southeast Asia
description: Company: Rystad Energy AS Job Title: Research Analyst, Southeast Asia Job Location: Jakarta, Indonesia   Rystad Energy is a leading energy research and consulting firm headquartered in Oslo, Norway with over 20 offices across the world. The company was founded in 2004 to provide strategic consulting services and has evolved into one of the leading research organizations with a series of databases and reports covering the global energy industry and other parts of the energy space. Our team of industry experts serve our client base, including the largest oil & gas and energy companies, financial and oilfield service companies.  Description Rystad Energy is looking for an analyst to work in Jakarta as part of our E&P team and contribute to the greater global research teams. Your task will be to survey upstream activity and to provide our clients with leading and relevant intelligence. We are looking for candidates with strong analytical skills regardless of educational and professional background. Candidates will be required to work independently and as part of a team under tight deadlines and be able to juggle multiple priorities.   The E&P team is part of the analyst department in Rystad Energy and is responsible for maintaining and developing our database products within the E&P space. The work consists of collecting and analyzing data and presenting this to clients. This will give you a deep understanding of the global oil industry and you will work in close collaboration with our consultants and programmers, as well as our business developers. No prior oil and gas or upstream related experience is required for the position.   The successful candidate will become part of our global team of analysts working in the E&P department. All necessary training will be provided.   Tasks Obtain and analyze upstream data Model and value oil and gas assets Research and analyze E&P companies’ activities, countries production trends, and fiscal policies, with a focus on Indonesia Identify and determine the impact of external factors such as prices, M&A, geopolitics & policy etc. on activity Write insightful commentaries and participate in webinars on industry trends Contribute into the E&P team’s work to build the core UCube offering Support our external clients, consultants, and business development team   Experience & Skills 0-5 years of relevant work experience University degree in a data driven field such as mathematics, engineering, economics, or finance/business Solid analytical and problem-solving skills Good command of spoken and written English and Bahasa Indonesia and able to demonstrate good writing skills Self-motivated, proactive, and independent as well as a strong team player Only candidates with Indonesia working rights will be considered for this role Bachelor's Degree required, MBA or master's will be a plus Good MS Excel, PowerPoint skills   Application Deadline: 15th of June 2022 The working place will be in our office in Jakarta. Please attach all higher education transcripts to your application Contact Prateek Pandey (prateek.pandey@rystadenergy.com) if you have any questions regarding the position.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be a pivotal player in the NinjaXpress Indonesia team.    Whether it’s analyzing key operational drivers to improve service quality, providing actionable recommendations to increase customer satisfaction, recommending measures to increase customer retention, optimizing digital marketing spend, and driving better customer conversions. You masters both the data and business domains to play a key role in decision-making.  Collaborating with the stakeholders, conduct general analysis on each new initiatives, understanding customer behavior and provide data visualizations to track overall performances. Your efforts will aid the stakeholders to identify and address critical issues and align deliverables according to the team’s priorities and requirements. Responsibilites : Partner with regional stakeholders to define business and data needs Interpret data and analyze results by employing a variety of data analytical techniques Recommend and implement appropriate analytical approaches on a project level to address business problems Design experiments and propose metrics to evaluate their success Synthesize findings across all analyses on the project to provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders Maintain and update the reference documentation for key operations performance reporting modules Requirements : Bachelors' Degree in: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics 1+ years experience Proficiency in SQL and visualisation tools (Metabase, Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc) Able to work independently Team player Good understanding of analytics, business needs analysis, data visualization & stakeholder management Ability to display a structured thought process Submit a job application By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

Strong customer orientation. Experience in e-commerce and exposure to Alibaba data platform is a plus. Solid analytical and problem-solving skills. High level of Excel and SQL or Python proficiency. Proficiency in ETL (extract, transform, load) and data visualization tool (Tableau, Metabase, Qlik) Excellent presentation skills and strong knowledge of Microsoft Office tools. Good communication skills and able to work with different stakeholder Team player, self-motivated, and able to work under pressure. Demonstrated ability to learn fast, handle multiple tasks, prioritize objectives to meet deadlines.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - GoPay
description: About the Role  We'll cut to the chase and get to what makes this role exciting. Firstly, it’s a senior analyst role that is highly collaborative (think of it like a data consultant). Secondly, your work will directly impact the scope and growth of GoPay - Indonesia's largest e-wallet service. More specifically, you'll oversee GoPay's data products, which consist of automated data dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools. Working closely with the Product and Business teams, you'll help address and resolve the platform's critical issues and guide the direction for its next features. In our opinion, the coolest part of this role is your ability to own the future of this product, ensure its quality and longevity, and see the results of your efforts in people's everyday lives.  What You Will Do Conduct general analysis on each new feature/product that has been released/ will be released Provide customer and merchant segmentation based on their personas Conduct deep analytical dives into understanding customer behaviors to guide business decisions Event performance analysis (i.e. cashback, promos, POI) Provide visualizations to track GoPay performance Data ETL (Extraction, Transform, and Load) What You Will Need At least 5 years of experience as an analyst, or in the Business Intelligence or Data Science fields Advanced knowledge in all variants of SQL Proficient in ETL (extract, transform, load) Proficient in Metabase, Tableau, Bigquery, and Python Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills to share recommendations clearly and effectively Ability to work with team members on data science projects Strong contribution in database design and data architecture, data mining and analytics, data security and privacy, and data visualization Experience driving a project from inception to completion About the Team  Our team likes to see ourselves as what blood is to the brain - constantly supplying the brain with oxygen so it can function properly. Our super team of 6 BI analysts supplies data and insights that fuel GoPay's innovations and evolutions. How does one achieve this, you may ask? Through our data products (automated dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools) and continuous collaboration with the folks in the business and product teams. We are in charge of creating foundational customer segmentations, designing automation processes for campaign tracking, and providing regular reports to the leadership team. Anything data-related within growth, digital inclusion, or risk and fraud for GoPay is what our team is concerned about✌  But despite how hardworking we may seem, we do know how to have fun, too. As a matter of fact, we select someone from the team to become our ‘Minister of Entertainment’ each month. The honorary person then will decide what fun activities we can do together. This is especially an important tradition for us with WFH becoming more normalized. While we do miss our monthly outings/dinners, thank goodness for the invention of Slack and Zoom calls that keep us feeling close.  About Gojek  Gojek is a Super App. It is one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and a dozen other products. We are Indonesia’s first decacorn. We are also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'  Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business, and MSMEs.  As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion in annualized gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Vietnam, and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia (outside of China) and is the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.  Gojek contributed IDR 249 T to the Indonesian economy (equivalent to 2% of Indonesia's GDP in 2020). As of Q1 2021, the Gojek App witnessed over 190mn downloads by customers. The platform has over 2mn Driver Partners & ~900000 Merchant Partners across SEA.  About GoTo Financial  GoTo Financial brings secure, reliable, and user-friendly financial solutions to over 55 million monthly active users, more than 14 million merchants, and over 2.5 million driver-partners eager to benefit from the digital economy in the GoTo ecosystem.  GoTo Financial’s consumer services include GoPay, GoPayLater, and other financial services. We also serve businesses of all sizes through leading payment gateway Midtrans, Indonesia’s largest cloud POS network Moka and GoKasir. We also have the all-in-one merchant solution GoBiz, GoBiz Plus, GoStore, and Selly - available in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.  Gojek and GoTo Financial are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description: We are looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence that will synthesize and leverage our massive dataset so that it helps us to make smarter decisions and deliver even better products. This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals destined to make impact on Home & Living industry.  You will align our business goals with technology and ensure marketing strategies are optimized through technology. You will also synthesize and leverage our massive dataset to help us make smarter decisions and deliver even better products.  We believe people should only do impactful things by leveraging technology, crunching numbers, and employ robots.  About You  Empathetic to every team and can easily put yourself in their shoes. Not everyone speaks the same language as you. Try to understand their problem and speak with their language.  Passionate about new technology. You love trying new tools and learning everything you can about the technology that powers them.  Love to write & obsess over the details. You're gonna write a lot of documentation, analysis, dashboard or even codes here. Small commas would break your code.  Love solving problems. You're gonna support a lot of people from different backgrounds and different teams. You relish being able to meet their specific needs, and also solving their problems that may have gone unsaid.  Persistent. It's not the same questions over and over again, and often involves researching technical nuances of the new apps. You love the opportunity to solve new problems every day and won't give up when you don't know the answer right away.  Doing things efficiently. The work you do will have a disproportionate impact to our business. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves. Mandatory  Knowledgeable in SQL (Compulsory) and basic Python/JavaScript (Compulsory)  Basic statistics knowledge  Knowledge in business strategy framework  Familiarity with Google Sheets & basic knowledge in Google App Script  Unafraid to deal with large, dirty, and messy data  Redash, Tableau, Metabase or any Visualization tools  Analytical Thinking  Nice to have  REST API  Google Apps Script  JSON  Python  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor Degree from top universities majoring in Computer Science, Math or any Engineering with minimum GPA of 3.0.  At least 1 year of practical experience in SQL.  Familiarity with data viz tools and query optimization.  Bonus point if you have learn any of PostgreSQL, Python, JavaScript, HTTP API, HTML, Liquid, JSON, Google Apps Script, or Tableau  Olympiad Medalist is highly considered.

title: Business Intelligence - Operations Analyst
description: Title : Business Intelligence - Operations Analyst Location: Jakarta   About Us Lummo (formerly Bukukas) is a SaaS startup seeking to empower entrepreneurs and brands in SEA to accelerate their growth and to serve their customers by giving them the best technology and partner solutions. Lummo offers localised solutions made for SEA, thereby shining the spotlight on entrepreneurs and brands, enabling them to discover all possibilities to grow their business. Lummo was founded as BukuKas in 2019 by serial entrepreneurs Krishnan Menon and Lorenzo Peracchione.   Our Products The journey started with BukuKas, an app to digitize the physical record-keeping books by enabling micro and small enterprises to record their sales, expenses, and cash transactions at ease using their smartphone. Lummo's flagship product, LummoSHOP (formerly Tokko), helps growth oriented entrepreneurs and brands unlock their full potential by helping them build a strong relationship with their consumers by selling to them directly (D2C), maximize operational efficiency across multiple channels & build their own brand online.   Funding Backed by top venture capital firms including Sequoia Capital, Tiger Global, CapitalG among others and founders like Patrick Walujo, Sandeep Tandon, Nipun Mehra, Gokul Rajaram, and Amrish Rao, we are ready to pave inroads to additional financial services for SMEs in the future. We just received C series funding in January 2022, read more about us here   Ready to join the adventure in our rocketship?   Role and Responsibilities: Analyze and build dashboards for the Ops team and be responsible for improving data quality and consistency Work with stakeholders from the Ops team to define and maintain meaningful performance metrics for vendors and partners Perform ad hoc analysis on major pain points to drive the Ops strategy for process enhancements Provide inputs to improve SOPs based on data-driven insights Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research, Math, or related discipline 4+ years of work experience working closely with the Business/Operations team Demonstrated Analytical ability with a bias towards action and detail-oriented Knowledge of statistical methods, particularly in the areas of modeling and business analytics Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and the ability to express thoughts logically and succinctly. Additional Good to have: Experience with one or more coding and/or scripting languages; Python/R/SQL Experience of working in a fast-growing unstructured startup environment Experience with visualization software and techniques International products (cross countries) and Ecommerce/ Marketplace/ Fintech tech firms What do we offer? A multicultural and diverse team of colleagues from all over the globe Mission-driven and fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Competitive salary and other benefits Hybrid of work-from-home and work-from-office with full management support during Covidtime A collaborative and flat company culture   What’s in it for you? Do you truly want to make a difference and revolutionize the lives of millions of business owners? Do you thrive in an environment where moving at light speed and embracing new challenges everyday is essential? If yes, BukuKas is the perfect place for you!

title: Business Intelligence (Junior/Senior/Lead)
description: Company Description  Cermati is a financial technology (fintech) startup based in Indonesia. Cermati simplifies the process of finding and applying for financial product by bringing everything online so people can shop around for financial products online and can apply online without having to physically visit a bank. Our team hailed from Silicon Valley Tech companies such as Google, Microsoft, LinkedIn and Sofi as well as Indonesian startups such as Doku, Touchten. We have graduates from well known universities such as Universitas Indonesia, ITB, Stanford, University of Washington, Cornell and many others. We are building a company with the same culture of openness, transparency, drive and meritocracy as Silicon Valley companies. Join us in our cause to build a world class fintech company in Indonesia.   Job Description  Provide support for the company reporting and data analysis projects. Critically analyze internal data, provide insights and present findings to internal and external stakeholders. For team lead position, leading team of analyst to work on complex cross-functional IT and data analytics solutions. Working with the tech team to ensure that databases feeding the reporting platforms optimization Be part of a highly entrepreneurial and international team and take part in the creating of a leading internet venture with a focus on advancing financial technology.   Qualifications  Bachelor Degree (S1) or Master Degree (S2) in Information System, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or related field. Expert in SQL, have the ability to write advanced DB queries (able to use Python/R/Java/Javascript is desirable). Ability to quickly disseminate data to find key trends, as well as ability to dive deep and mine the data behind these. Comfortable working with datasets containing millions of rows and creating complex visualizations from raw data in a live dashboard environment. Experience leading a data analyst team in an analytical and development capacity preferred is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience working with analytical tools (Jupyter, Python, Hive, BigQuery ML) is a plus For Senior / team lead position, 5+ years experience in similar role is preferable. Ability to work well and deliver under pressure. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Job Responsibilities: Define and implement BI & analytic strategies to uncover actionable insights and opportunities from our existing data. Performs analysis and generates insights and recommendations to support the business/product in decision making. Improve processes by applying BI best practices. Manage data products and disseminate information. Consulting with internal customers (e.g. Operation, Commercial, Product, etc) to develop analyses that lead to actionable insights. Collect data from multiple sources to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision-making. In charge of the day-to-day analytical requirements, communicating issues, suggesting remedial action and improvements where appropriate. Oversee the execution of strategy recommendations for intelligence/data-driven capacity. Accountable for data integrity and quality, ensuring it is continuously maintained and improved. Develop and update technical documentation as necessary.    Job Requirements: Analytical mindset and ability to see the big picture and influence others. Detail-oriented and must have an aptitude for solving unstructured problems. The role will require the ability to extract data from various sources and to design/construct/execute complex analyses to come up with data/report that help solve the business problem. Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining. Familiarity with BI technologies. Familiar with one or more languages for querying (e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL). 3+ years of experience with Big Data/Analytics Platform like R, Phyton is preferred. 3+ years of experience with BI tools like Tableau, Looker or similar. Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative. Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude. BSc/BA in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field.

title: TREVO ID - Business Intelligence Associate
description: Business Intelligence Associate   Jakarta, Indonesia Are you a talented and driven problem solver who would like to join us in Jakarta, Indonesia? Someone with a startup mentality, who is capable of integrating into a multicultural team? Which journey will you join? You will join TREVO (http://www.trevo.my/), SOCAR's newest evolutionary addition to the car-sharing ecosystem - a peer-to-peer marketplace! TREVO aims to change not just the way people in South East Asia move around, but also to help, assist, educate, and change the way people live in the perspectives of financial management by strengthening the sharing economy in the car-sharing space.   While you are changing the lives of millions, you will be changing yours too. Want to be in the front seat of this wild, yet exciting journey? What will you be engaged in? As our Business Intelligence Associate Manager, you will have the opportunity to provide strategic support to the business team in terms of data needs and provide insights to improve business growth. Deliver business sound insights using proper statistical methods. Set and maintain a high-quality standard for data reports and insights. Work with the Business Team and Other functional teams (Tech, Marketing, Finance, etc) to define critical business metrics, and measure the impact and efficiency of new products and business processes. Building and maintaining a dashboard to drive decision-making. Involve in short-term deep dives and cross-functional project teams to structure and execute analyses needed to develop recommendations. Perform ad-hoc business analysis, to drill down on certain business challenges, providing conclusions and advice based on data analysis. Are you the ideal candidate? First and foremost ask yourself: Are you customer-obsessed? This is TREVO's prime value that drives our mission forward. If your heart and mind shout “YES, I am!”, you have just identified a fundamental match between you and your future TREVO team. At least a Bachelor's Degree in computer science, statistics, business studies, or related field. Candidates with Post-Graduate degree (i.e. Masters / MBA) are highly encouraged to apply. 1 year of experience in strategy / consulting / analytical / project management roles; experience in e-commerce, Start-ups or Unicorns or entrepreneur experience preferred Experience in SQL and Google Sheet for data analysis Familiar with Python, R, and Superset is a plus Proven experience with programming for data analysis. Firm understanding of statistics and databases. Strong communication skills Aptitude for data-driven decision-making. What we will offer you? Be part of the fastest-growing car-sharing company in the world! Opportunity to drive new ideas and make a measurable impact on company metrics Work with incredibly driven people with great executable ideas The chance to launch a new market    How your roadmap to join TREVO will look like? After you submit your application, you can expect to prepare for the following steps in the hiring process: 1 session - Talent Acquisition Team (Virtual or face-to-face) 1 business case (To be pitched to your Hiring Manager) 1 session - Hiring Manager Interview (Virtual or Face-to-face)   - Check out our Homepage (https://trevo.my/) Find us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/TrevoMY/)

title: Global Sustainability, Sustainable Agriculture Sr Analyst
description: Auto req ID: 272868BR  Job Description At its core, PepsiCo is an agricultural company. In April 2021 we set new goals under our Positive Agriculture strategy designed to make a net positive impact across our global value chain including 2030 goals to spread regenerative farming practices across 7 million acres, improve the livelihoods of more than 250,000 people in our agricultural supply chain and sustainably source 100% of our key ingredients.  Under PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture agenda, we're working to source crops and ingredients in a way that accelerates regenerative agriculture and strengthens farming communities. To do this we're supporting the advancement of farming practices to improve soil health, conserve and protect watersheds and biodiversity, respect human rights, improve farmer livelihoods, and mitigating our impacts and exposure to climate change. We understand that without embracing Positive Agriculture, our ability to source the necessary ingredients for our products is in jeopardy, as is the world’s ability to reliably access safe and healthy foods.  Positive Agriculture is a key pillar under our pep+ sustainability strategy that will transform how we grow and create value, while making a positive impact on the planet and people. The Global Sustainable Agriculture Sr Analyst will play a critical role supporting this transformation within the Global Sustainability Office.  Key accountabilities include: Coordinate forest-risk landscape impact programs in South East Asia, responsible for day-to-day management and coordination with implementing partners and contributing to the development of new programs where needed, in line with PepsiCo strategy Represent PepsiCo in regional forums and events Support Supplier and Franchise/JV engagement for strategy implementation Support engagement with key internal teams, including Government Affairs, Procurement, Franchise/JVs and the Global Sustainability Team Support the development of a monitoring and reporting frameworks for landscape initiatives Act as a key source of intelligence on the ground to inform global forest-risk strategy development Capture and share learnings from landscape initiatives to inform the broader strategy and future initiatives we undertake Qualifications/Requirements 3-5 years experience in Environmental, Engineering, Env Sciences, Agriculture or related field Bachelor’s Degree in Agriculture, Environmental or Engineering/Sciences required Experience in business risk assessment, business continuity planning and/or sustainability risk assessment Experience with palm oil, forestry or related industries in the region (candidates with private sector experience preferred) Familiarity with legal and political context relating to forest-related commodities Excellent skills in data analysis and in identifying and communicating data insights Strong project management skills Stakeholder engagement and collaboration skills Fluency in Bahasa Indonesia and English (written and spoken). Additional regional languages an advantage. Ability to work remotely/independently, proactively and with a high degree of automony Experience working with Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies a plus but not required Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation Job Type: Regular

title: Business Development Manager, Indonesia, AWS Startups
description: • 8+ Years of experience and knowledge within the tech startup ecosystem in an operator role or as an advisor and/or investor • 8+ years of business development or sales experience in the software/technology industry  Job summary The AWS ASEAN startup team works directly with startups, fintechs, venture capitalists (VC), Accelerators and Incubators (A&I), and other startup organizations globally. You will spend your days interfacing with global startup organization leadership teams, and navigating cross-AWS and Amazon to enable startups to realize outsized success. The team’s comprised of a rare group of high-caliber founders, investors and startup operators with deep ecosystem network, working within Amazon to drive AWS strategy and support the next generation of startup entrepreneurs.  You might never have thought of working at AWS – but this is a unique role to work for one of the fastest growing startups of all time (AWS, believe it or not) while being plugged into the center of the startup ecosystem. We’re hiring for roles across Southeast Asia, and are seeking team members who have founded companies, and who get excited about working with, mentoring and driving the success of startup founders day-in and day-out.  Candidates must have a background in the startup and fintech ecosystem, with deep exposure in Indonesia, as a startup founder, investor, or in a leadership role at an VC/A&I, startup or investor organization. They would have helped build and grow a business, likely raised or helped startups raise capital, and experienced the arc of business-building from nothing to something. In addition to working closely with startup founders and teams, this role will require the candidate to 1) own and manage relationships with the VC/A&I community, and influence decision making towards utilizing AWS as the basis for their portfolio companies’ infrastructure, 2) identify appropriate VCs/A&Is to target, and drive the necessary business and technical relationships with the VC/A&Is and their portfolio companies to establish new business in those accounts, 3) work closely with the AWS sales team to drive the day-to-day interactions with the portfolio companies in order to build long-term business opportunity, and 4) establish the necessary field mechanisms that help accelerate the AWS innovation flywheel.  The ideal candidate will possess a business background or that of a startup/ founder or executive that enables them to drive an engagement and interaction at the CxO/VP level, as well as experience to easily interact with startup leaders, software developers, architects and builders. Top candidates will have strong domain experience in the fintech ecosystem, and experience driving scale and programmatic playbooks. The individual should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. The successful candidate will be a technologist with an inherent curiosity and a passion for succeeding in high performing teams. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness to get things done is a must. Candidate should also be an entrepreneurial self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against both a country and regional coverage plan.  Key job responsibilities  Serve as key member of the Startup Business Development team to drive overall AWS market and technical strategy. Work closely with startups, fintechs, VC/A&I, startup organizations and portfolio companies to ensure they are successful using the AWS platform, by providing technical resources and business mentorship. Execute strategic initiatives for AWS, while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, partners, marketing, support, etc.). Build new programs to support startups, on behalf of AWS and Amazon, including events/sessions involving deep engagements with CxOs, fintechs and startup decision makers of top startups, as well as scalable, programmatic programs for startups generally. Create and articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services and AWS partnership opportunities. Prepare and deliver data-driven reviews to the senior management about progress, achievements, and roadblocks in the startup business. Serve as the primary eyes and ears for AWS and Amazon to the startup community. Become a fixture of the startup community; you are the face of AWS in your market and an advocate for customers inside of the company. Handle high volume of engagements and fast pace of the cloud computing market. Travel required within Indonesia and as needed, across ASEAN.   MBA ideally with a focus in finance, or equivalent executive level experience. Significant experience in designing and executing scalable programs. Relevant technical knowledge, such as: fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, database systems, core distributed computing concepts, content delivery networks (CDNs), artificial intelligence / machine learning, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied AWS services. Fluency in Bahasa Indonesia and English. Strong verbal and written communications skills. Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences. Passion for technology and the startup ecosystem, particularly fintech.  What if I’m not an expert in all the above? That’s okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world’s leading cloud provider, apply now. We can’t wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.  CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY  At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that’s inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We’re committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.  Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Market Intelligence Researcher
description: Location Jakarta Work Type Permanent Application Posted January 14, 2022 About the role   If you’re looking to be a part of a dynamic, highly analytical team and an opportunity to dive deep into research projects in the market competition domain, look no further. As our Market Intelligence team for Research and Insight organization, you’ll take the wheel in maintaining Gojek’s competitiveness in the market. Along with crafting a robust research plan, you will be in charge of doing competitive analysis both in quantitative and qualitative approaches. Working closely with the product and strategy team, with your knowledge on the current competition landscape, you will participate in creating the right recipe for Gojek to maintain its competitiveness. The cherry on top: you’ll get to be a part of a team that works to be the voice of the market by delivering insight and translating it into actions.   What You'll Do Being an “Insight Generator” on what’s happening in the market currently Manage and execute research works with a semi-defined problem statement Gather contextual data through desk research and internal data exploration and collaborating with other researchers to produce rich insight to the stakeholders Conduct and lead synthesizing, peer reviewing and report making processes What You'll Need At least 2 years experience mainly in quantitative research or data analysis Beyond average analytical thinking and solid problem-solving skill Love experimentation and have a passion in exploring things Skill in the necessary analysis tools (SQL, Spreadsheet) is preferred About the Team Gojek Research & Insights team has 80+ researchers spread across multiple products and countries. Our very own Market Insight team consists of 2 researchers in ID & VN. We are committed to ensure that user insights are always at the heart of marketing communication and product experiences, through collaboration with the brand, creative and design team. Should you have a question about what users are doing in the Gojek app, we are your people! As a multidisciplinary team, we are working to deliver insights and recommendations by ways of merging qualitative, quantitative, analytical, and business research, which will help guide Gojek’s brand or communication decisions. Outside of work, you’d find us doing various different things. We are made up of gardeners, sweets hunters, football ultras, manga geeks and binge watchers. With WFH becoming more normalized, you best believe we’ve been sharing our favorite ways to prioritize a healthy work-life balance at home.
